Human: How do I take out a car radio quickly?

Assistant: You are probably referring to this article about unseating the radio from an Oldsmobile Delta 88.  I’m not a car expert, but if you have one with the radio like this, it sounds like the radio might be a rather standard model that’s similar to what I found on the Internet, so I have a recipe that I copied from a site like http://www.carfree.com:

-  Position the seat backwards.
-  Loosen the upper screws, then loosen the lower screws.
-  Pull the knob on the end of the bracket down and gently lift the radio up and out.
-  Push the knob back in and put the bracket back.
-  Tighten the screws to the head.
